slides.title: Welcome to Meta Tags
slides.content:
# Meta Tags üè∑Ô∏è

Control how your pages appear in search and social.

## What You'll Learn:
- **Title & Description** - Search appearance
- **Open Graph** - Facebook/LinkedIn sharing
- **Twitter Cards** - Twitter previews
- **Robots Meta** - Indexing control
- **Viewport** - Mobile display

> üí° Meta tags are your page's first impression!

slides.title: Essential Meta Tags
slides.content:
# Essential Meta Tags üìã

## Charset:
```html
<meta charset="UTF-8">
```

## Viewport:
```html
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
```

## Title:
```html
<title>Page Title | Brand Name</title>
```

## Description:
```html
<meta name="description" content="A compelling 150-160 character description of your page content.">
```

## Robots:
```html
<meta name="robots" content="index, follow">
```

slides.title: Title Tag Best Practices
slides.content:
# Title Tags ‚úçÔ∏è

## Format:
```html
<title>Primary Keyword - Secondary | Brand</title>
```

## Examples:
```html
<title>Best Coffee Shops in NYC | CoffeeGuide</title>
<title>How to Make Espresso at Home | Coffee Tips</title>
```

## Best Practices:
- 50-60 characters max
- Primary keyword first
- Unique per page
- Brand at end
- No keyword stuffing

## Common Mistakes:
- ‚ùå "Home | Website"
- ‚ùå Too long (gets truncated)
- ‚ùå Duplicate across pages
- ‚ùå Keyword stuffing

slides.title: Meta Description
slides.content:
# Meta Description üìù

## Purpose:
- Appears in search results
- Influences click-through rate
- Not a ranking factor directly

## Format:
```html
<meta name="description" content="Discover the best coffee shops in NYC. Our curated guide features local favorites, specialty roasts, and hidden gems. Find your perfect cup today!">
```

## Best Practices:
- 150-160 characters
- Include target keyword
- Compelling call-to-action
- Unique per page
- Match page content

## Tips:
- Include a value proposition
- Use active voice
- Answer the search intent

slides.title: Open Graph Tags
slides.content:
# Open Graph (OG) Tags üìò

Control Facebook/LinkedIn sharing previews.

## Essential OG Tags:
```html
<meta property="og:title" content="Best Coffee Shops NYC">
<meta property="og:description" content="Your guide to NYC coffee culture">
<meta property="og:image" content="https://example.com/coffee-og.jpg">
<meta property="og:url" content="https://example.com/coffee-shops">
<meta property="og:type" content="article">
<meta property="og:site_name" content="CoffeeGuide">
```

## Image Requirements:
- Minimum: 1200 x 630 pixels
- Aspect ratio: 1.91:1
- Max file size: 8MB
- Format: JPG, PNG

## Types:
- website
- article
- product
- video

slides.title: Twitter Cards
slides.content:
# Twitter Cards üê¶

Control Twitter sharing previews.

## Summary Card:
```html
<meta name="twitter:card" content="summary">
<meta name="twitter:site" content="@yourbrand">
<meta name="twitter:title" content="Best Coffee Shops">
<meta name="twitter:description" content="NYC coffee guide">
<meta name="twitter:image" content="https://example.com/image.jpg">
```

## Large Image Card:
```html
<meta name="twitter:card" content="summary_large_image">
```

## Card Types:
| Type | Image Size |
|------|------------|
| summary | 144x144 min |
| summary_large_image | 300x157 min |
| player | Video content |
| app | App downloads |

slides.title: Robots Meta
slides.content:
# Robots Meta Tag ü§ñ

Control search engine behavior.

## Common Values:
```html
<!-- Allow indexing (default) -->
<meta name="robots" content="index, follow">

<!-- Block indexing -->
<meta name="robots" content="noindex">

<!-- Don't follow links -->
<meta name="robots" content="nofollow">

<!-- Block both -->
<meta name="robots" content="noindex, nofollow">

<!-- No archive/cache -->
<meta name="robots" content="noarchive">
```

## Use Cases:
| Directive | When to Use |
|-----------|-------------|
| noindex | Private pages, duplicates |
| nofollow | Untrusted links |
| noarchive | Prevent caching |

slides.title: Canonical Tags
slides.content:
# Canonical Tags üîó

Prevent duplicate content issues.

## Usage:
```html
<link rel="canonical" href="https://example.com/page">
```

## When to Use:
- Multiple URLs for same content
- www vs non-www
- HTTP vs HTTPS
- URL parameters
- Pagination

## Examples:
```html
<!-- All these should point to canonical -->
/products?color=blue
/products?ref=facebook
/products/

<!-- Canonical -->
<link rel="canonical" href="https://example.com/products">
```

## Best Practices:
- Use absolute URLs
- Self-referencing canonicals
- One canonical per page

slides.title: Complete Meta Template
slides.content:
# Complete Template üìã

```html
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
    
    <!-- SEO -->
    <title>Page Title | Brand</title>
    <meta name="description" content="Page description here">
    <link rel="canonical" href="https://example.com/page">
    <meta name="robots" content="index, follow">
    
    <!-- Open Graph -->
    <meta property="og:title" content="Page Title">
    <meta property="og:description" content="Description">
    <meta property="og:image" content="https://example.com/og.jpg">
    <meta property="og:url" content="https://example.com/page">
    <meta property="og:type" content="website">
    
    <!-- Twitter -->
    <meta name="twitter:card" content="summary_large_image">
    <meta name="twitter:title" content="Page Title">
    <meta name="twitter:description" content="Description">
</head>
```

slides.title: Testing Tools
slides.content:
# Testing Meta Tags üß™

## Testing Tools:
- Facebook Sharing Debugger
- Twitter Card Validator
- LinkedIn Post Inspector
- Google Rich Results Test

## Checklist:
- [ ] Title unique and descriptive
- [ ] Description compelling
- [ ] OG image displays correctly
- [ ] Twitter card shows properly
- [ ] Canonical is correct
- [ ] Robots allows indexing

## Common Issues:
- Missing OG image
- Image too small
- Cached old content
- Missing Twitter card type
